column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=LOST ON PELLUCIDAR

#Text=The Arabs , of whom I wrote you at the end of my last letter ( Innes began ) , and whom I thought to be enemies intent only upon murdering me , proved to be exceedingly friendly -- they were searching for the very band of marauders that had threatened my existence .

#Text=The huge rhamphorhynchus-like reptile that I had brought back with me from the inner world -- the ugly Mahar that Hooja the Sly One had substituted for my dear Dian at the moment of my departure -- filled them with wonder and with awe .
#Text=Nor less so did the mighty subterranean prospector which had carried me to Pellucidar and back again , and which lay out in the desert about two miles from my camp .

#Text=With their help I managed to get the unwieldy tons of its great bulk into a vertical position -- the nose deep in a hole we had dug in the sand and the rest of it supported by the trunks of date-palms cut for the purpose .
#Text=It was a mighty engineering job with only wild Arabs and their wilder mounts to do the work of an electric crane -- but finally it was completed , and I was ready for departure .
#Text=For some time I hesitated to take the Mahar back with me .
#Text=She had been docile and quiet ever since she had discovered herself virtually a prisoner aboard the " iron mole . "
#Text=It had been , of course , impossible for me to communicate with her since she had no auditory organs and I no knowledge of her fourth-dimension , sixth-sense method of communication .
#Text=Naturally I am kind-hearted , and so I found it beyond me to leave even this hateful and repulsive thing alone in a strange and hostile world .
#Text=The result was that when I entered the iron mole I took her with me .

#Text=That she knew that we were about to return to Pellucidar was evident , for immediately her manner changed from that of habitual gloom that had pervaded her , to an almost human expression of contentment and delight .
#Text=Our trip through the earth 's crust was but a repetition of my two former journeys between the inner and the outer worlds .

#Text=This time , however , I imagine that we must have maintained a more nearly perpendicular course , for we accomplished the journey in a few minutes ' less time than upon the occasion of my first journey through the five-hundred-mile crust .
#Text=Just a trifle less than seventy-two hours after our departure into the sands of the Sahara , we broke through the surface of Pellucidar .

#Text=Fortune once again favored me by the slightest of margins , for when I opened the door in the prospector 's outer jacket I saw that we had missed coming up through the bottom of an ocean by but a few hundred yards .

#Text=The aspect of the surrounding country was entirely unfamiliar to me -- I had no conception of precisely where I was upon the one hundred and twenty-four million square miles of Pellucidar 's vast land surface .
#Text=The perpetual midday sun poured down its torrid rays from zenith , as it had done since the beginning of Pellucidarian time -- as it would continue to do to the end of it .

#Text=Before me , across the wide sea , the weird , horizonless seascape folded gently upward to meet the sky until it lost itself to view in the azure depths of distance far above the level of my eyes .
#Text=How strange it looked !
#Text=How vastly different from the flat and puny area of the circumscribed vision of the dweller upon the outer crust !
#Text=I was lost .
#Text=Though I wandered ceaselessly throughout a lifetime , I might never discover the whereabouts of my former friends of this strange and savage world .
#Text=Never again might I see dear old Perry , nor Ghak the Hairy One , nor Dacor the Strong One , nor that other infinitely precious one -- my sweet and noble mate , Dian the Beautiful !
#Text=But even so I was glad to tread once more the surface of Pellucidar .
#Text=Mysterious and terrible , grotesque and savage though she is in many of her aspects , I can not but love her .
#Text=Her very savagery appealed to me , for it is the savagery of unspoiled Nature .
#Text=The magnificence of her tropic beauties enthralled me .
#Text=Her mighty land areas breathed unfettered freedom .
#Text=Her untracked oceans , whispering of virgin wonders unsullied by the eye of man , beckoned me out upon their restless bosoms .
#Text=Not for an instant did I regret the world of my nativity .
#Text=I was in Pellucidar .
#Text=I was home .
#Text=And I was content .

#Text=As I stood dreaming beside the giant thing that had brought me safely through the earth 's crust , my traveling companion , the hideous Mahar , emerged from the interior of the prospector and stood beside me .
#Text=For a long time she remained motionless .
#Text=What thoughts were passing through the convolutions of her reptilian brain ?
#Text=I do not know .
#Text=She was a member of the dominant race of Pellucidar .
#Text=By a strange freak of evolution her kind had first developed the power of reason in that world of anomalies .
#Text=To her , creatures such as I were of a lower order .

#Text=As Perry had discovered among the writings of her kind in the buried city of Phutra , it was still an open question among the Mahars as to whether man possessed means of intelligent communication or the power of reason .
#Text=Her kind believed that in the center of all-pervading solidity there was a single , vast , spherical cavity , which was Pellucidar .
#Text=This cavity had been left there for the sole purpose of providing a place for the creation and propagation of the Mahar race .
#Text=Everything within it had been put there for the uses of the Mahar .
